DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Tissue Donor ISBT-128 Donation Identification Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A globally unique identifier assigned to a hematopoietic cell transplantation ISBT-128 donation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

Property.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A globally unique identifier that is assigned to each collection and each pooled product. The identifier is composed of four parts: a Facility Identification Number (FIN), a year of assignment, a serial number, and flag characters.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A donor identification number that conforms to the ISBT-128 standard for traceability of human blood, blood products, tissues, and organs.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A globally unique identifier that is assigned to each collection and each pooled product. The identifier is composed of four parts: a Facility Identification Number (FIN), a year of assignment, a serial number, and flag characters.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: .Concept Name change from "Donor" to "Donation" but automatically updated.  AK 6/21/17
